results.title: Malaya posting
results.brief_description: Australian overseas army personnel in Malaya. The contrasts of old and new in this multi-racial Asian country; surrender barracks and the facilities for servicemen’s families; training in jungle warfare, tropical first aid; transport in the jungle; sports and places to visit in leisure time. Australia’s servicemen as ambassadors.

results.title: Malacca: then and now
results.brief_description: Shows Malacca, a small port in Malaya with a long history, including relics of the Hindus, Muslims, Portugese, Dutch and British. Provides glimpses of the religious traditions brought by these peoples, as well as the ancient funeral ceremonies of the Chinese. Claims that Malacca shows how Eastern and Western ways of life can settle down tolerantly together.

results.title: Making shoes (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This film aims to show school children how shoes are manufactured in a modern American factory. It traces the entire process from cutting the leather, through assembly of the various parts of the shoe, to the final polishing and packing.

results.title: Making sense [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Francis Fuchs, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Children Growing Up”.
A new born baby has all the five senses needed to perceive his outside world, but making something of it is a slow developmental process. This program constructs situations and experiments to demonstrate how a child sees and makes sense of the world.

results.title: Making haiku
results.creator_credit: Annette Klingman and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Introduces and explains the form of Haiku and scenes from nature which inspire Haiku. Emphasises the simplicity and beauty of this form of poetry and encourages students creativity in composing their own. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Making grass silage
results.creator_credit: Margaret Thomson, Great Britain. Ministry of Agriculture and Realist Films
results.brief_description: Shows methods used by British farmers for making grass silage. Covers the whole process, from mowing to use as fodder. Demonstrates methods of packing a silo, adding molasses, and ensuring proper temperature to mature the silage. Shows also use of a pit - an alternative device to a silo.

results.title: Making a pack basket
results.creator_credit: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service
results.brief_description: Pop Williams, an old-timer, demonstrates techniques for making a pack basket. He begins with the actual cutting down of an ash tree, stripping it out, and step by step, pounding out the weaving strips, weaving, attaching rims, handles and shoulder straps.

results.title: Making a decision in the family
results.creator_credit: Julia Murphy, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Discussion film for adults on parental authority and teenagers. When a high-school girl declares her preference for going to a gathering of her own friends rather than to a family gathering, she runs headlong into her parent’s objections. It is their decision and not hers which is to abide. The result is a clash of wills. The question of what might have been a better approach is left with the film audience.

results.title: Making a car bumper
results.creator_credit: Brent Productions and Topical Film Company
results.brief_description: The making of a steel bumper by a machine press is used to illustrate the skill of the makers of press tools, the punch and the die, by means of which quantities of bumpers can be produced with a minimum of skilled labour. A vocational guidance film showing the skilled work of the tool maker in large-scale production engineering.

results.title: Making a canoe
results.creator_credit: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Two boys, with the help of an adult instructor, make a slalom canoe from glass reinforced plastic. The processes involved are shown step by step. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
